Journal.Title: The Science of the total environment

Article.ArticleTitle: Highly efficient catalytic ozonation for ammonium in water upon γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>@Fe/Mg with acidic-basic sites and oxygen vacancies.

AbstractText: Catalytic ozonation has prospects in the advanced treatment of nitrogen removal, and solid base MgO can efficiently catalyze the ozonation of ammonium nitrogen. However, it is necessary to improve the problem of easy loss, difficult recovery, and low percentage of gaseous products. Here, MgO, amorphous Fe<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>, and γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> were selected as doping components and supports, respectively, to prepare γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>@Fe/Mg composite catalysts with abundant acidic-basic sites and oxygen vacancies. The results show that γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>@Fe/Mg<sub>5</sub> can efficiently catalyze the ozonation of ammonium nitrogen (98.73%) with 67.82% gaseous product selectivity under the conditions of initial pH = 7, catalyst dosage of 112.88 g/L, and ozone dosage of 2.4 mg/min. The doping of Fe<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> and MgO with a weaker lattice oxygen binding energy improves the gaseous product selectivity. The mechanism of ammonium nitrogen removal for γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>@Fe/Mg<sub>5</sub> is revealed, especially the intrinsic contribution of acidic-basic sites and oxygen vacancies. The pH and active sites play different roles in ozone decomposition for NH<sub>4</sub><sup>+</sup> removal. Surface hydroxyl protonation on basic sites and oxygen vacancies and electron transfer on acidic sites are responsible for ozone decomposition to hydroxyl radicals. Moreover, γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>@Fe/Mg<sub>5</sub> exhibits good stability, few leaching ions, and can be settled in water for easy recovery. This study suggests that γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>@Fe/Mg<sub>5</sub> is a good candidate for the catalytic ozonation of ammonium nitrogen.
